ygData.subject: Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: All good points, I never looked at it that way Salr.
ygData.messageBody:
All good points, I never looked at it that way Salr.

> ----------
> From: Jason Coan[SMTP:COANJ@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 4:00 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> >>> David Rogers <derogers334@...> 5.24.99 12:57:55 PM >>>
>
> >>>Uh ... ok. If you say so. I call Paladins 'self-filling tanks',
> >>>because they are just that. They're not really effective until they
> >>>get Meditate at 12th, but once there they can do a solo fight that
> >>>drags them down to 1 bar of HP; and be back in another fight in 7-10
> >>>mins. For a corresponding warrior, it would be 13-18 mins, or more.
>
> The game isn't based upon solo play, and after about 20th lvl you
> basically can't solo. So whats it matter if a 12th lvl paladin has a few
> minutes quicker recovery at LOW level. I never fought solo past about 9
> anyways.
>
> >>>Lay On Hands is the Panic Button; you can push it to get out of jail,
> >>>or at least, have more time to either finish off the mob or run for
> >>>safety.
>
> I agree with you there. But at high 20s anybody can go get a pair of
> Jboots and have a continual free non-class specific get outta jail free
> card.
>
> >>>As for the spells being 9 levels behind, so? Paladins are
> >>>fighter/healers, while Clerics are healer/fighters. Clerics can be
> >>>mini-tanks up until about 9th or 10th; but Paladins can tank all the
> >>>way to 50. The ability to tank and still have a reserve to compliment
> >>>the party's cleric is useful. Past 10th, Clerics are 80%+ casters for
> >>>all realistic intents and purposes.
>
> Paladins don't have the HP of a warrior, so they can't tank as long. They
> don't have their dodge/parry/reposte are several levels behind a warrior,
> meaning they never get those skills as high as a warrior of the same
> level. Add that in with their lesser HP and there is a huge difference.
> Ok, so the paladin can help heal himself after a fight.....whooptee, if he
> were a fighter he wouldn't have so much to be healed anyways. not like a
> 25 point heal at 25th lvl is going to do much anyways.
>
> >>>Paladins don't get Kick; but at 6th they get bash which I personally
> >>>like much better. Kick won't interrupt casting, while Bash will. I
> >>>stopped using Kick with my Troll Warrior when I got Bash (which let my
> >>>Slam start being much more effective)
>
> I've found kick to be almost as good as bash, you'd be suprised at how
> often a 15 point kick will disrupt a caster.
>
> >>>If you're fixated on Dual Wield (which I think you might be, since you
> >>>mentioned Rangers; and they're the only hybrid, that I recall, that
> >>>gets Dual Wield); that might explain why you like Warriors and Rangers
> >>>the most.
>
> I'm not fixated on dual wield. I'm maxed on both my 1h slash and 2h
> slash, depending on the toughness of the monster I'm fighting I'll switch.
> Being able to use both is a tremenous advantage, IMO. Dual wield fast
> weapons when fighting yellow or reds, wield hard hitting 2h when whites or
> blues. And of course being able to use both means you have access to more
> of the good weapons.
>
> >>>Personally, I think the jury's still out on Dual Wield, and on melee in
> >>>general. The further up you go, the more the offensive and debuff
> >>>spellcasters really carry the fight to the mobs; the tanks are just
> >>>there to do what their name says. If this is proven out, then Dueal
> >>>Wield or no, the tanks are just there to soak damage. If this is not
> >>>proven, then Dual Wield still has to debate against the endless fighter
> >>>arguements of Dual Wield vs 2H Weapons (which is one of those semantic
> >>>arguements, IMO; stats bear each out)
>
> EXACTALLY warriors tank, paladins attempt to tank. The damage either
> deals is minimal, both are in the party for one reason....to keep the
> casters alive long enough to kill the mobs. So what would be better, a
> tank that can absorb all the damage with fewer heals required by the
> cleric, or a semi-tank that requires more heals from the cleric, thus more
> of a chance the monster will jump the cleric?
>
> >>>For grouping, I'd prefer to have pure tank in the tank slot, any day of
> >>>the week; with a Paladin fighting alongside him. (my ideal 6man group
> >>>is 2 Warriors, 1 Paladin, 1 Cleric, 1 Wizard, 1 Bard; haven't assembled
> >>>it yet, but it sounds fun!) For soloing, however, the Paladin is more
> >>>efficient than the Warrior.
>
> 2 tanks, why do you need a paladin? More than 2 fighter types in a party
> is over kill. Try to hook up with 2 warriors, cleric, shaman, 2 wizards.
> Warriors tank, cleric buffs and heals, shaman buffs debuffs and provides
> backup heals if needed, wizards nuke....works great.
>
> btw, I've only seen 2 shamans that were worth a crap.....they actually use
> their buff debuff spells well, all the rest I've seen spend all their mana
> on their little frost spell....SHAMANS ARE NOT NUKERS.....bah.....but
> thats another story....
>
> But to sum up, paladins sacrifice so much melee ability for so little
> casting ability which completly overlays the clerics role. Sure, at lower
> levels the paladin may be better solo, but A) he levels slower than a
> warrior, and B) after about 20th lvl you arn't going to be soloing much of
> anything anyways.
>
> Salr D'Taynkk
> Dark Warrior of The Kith
> Veeshan
>
>

> Give back to your community through "Grow to Give."
> http://www.ONElist.com
> See homepage for details.
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> For the Honor and Glory of the Warlord, Rallos Zek!
>
